sub_topic: Determining the rank of a matrix
message_1:
What is the rank of the following matrix:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
4 & 5 & 6 \\
7 & 8 & 9 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$
message_2:
To find the rank of the given matrix, we need to perform Gaussian elimination to bring it to its row echelon form or reduced row echelon form. Let's perform Gaussian elimination:

Original matrix:
$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
4 & 5 & 6 \\
7 & 8 & 9 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Subtract 4 times the first row from the second row:
$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
0 & -3 & -6 \\
7 & 8 & 9 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Subtract 7 times the first row from the third row:
$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
0 & -3 & -6 \\
0 & -6 & -12 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Divide the second row by -3:
$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
0 & 1 & 2 \\
0 & -6 & -12 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Add 6 times the second row to the third row:
$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
0 & 1 & 2 \\
0 & 0 & 0 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

The matrix is now in row echelon form. We can see that there are two non-zero rows, so the rank of the matrix is 2.
